fields.name: Bobcat Requirement 1
fields.contents: Learn and say the CUB SCOUT PROMISE and complete the Honesty Character Connection
fields.additional_info: 1.  Know: Discuss these questions with your family. What is a promise? What does it mean to 'keep your word?' What does honesty mean? What does it mean to 'do your best?'2. Commit: Discuss these questions with your family. Why is a promise important? Why is it important for people to trust you when you give your word? When might it be difficult to keep your word? List examples. 3. Practice: Discuss with family members why it is important to be trustworthy and honest and how can you do your best to be honest when you are doing the activities in Cub Scouting."I .....(name).... promise to do my best, To do my duty to God and my country, To help other people, and To obey the Law of the Pack.

fields.name: Bobcat Requirement 2
fields.contents: Say the LAW OF THE PACK.  Tell what it means.
fields.additional_info: The Cub Scout follows Akela. The Cub Scout helps the pack go. The pack helps the Cub Scout Grow. The Cub Scout gives goodwill.

fields.name: Bobcat Requirement 3
fields.contents: Tell what WEBELOS means

fields.name: Bobcat Requirement 4
fields.contents: Show the CUB SCOUT SIGN.  Tell what it means.

fields.name: Bobcat Requirement 5
fields.contents: Show the CUB SCOUT HANDSHAKE. Tell what it means.

fields.name: Bobcat Requirement 6
fields.contents: Say the CUB SCOUT MOTTO. A motto is a guiding principle.

fields.name: Bobcat Requirement 7
fields.contents: Give the CUB SCOUT SALUTE.  Tell what it means.

fields.name: Bobcat Requirement 8
fields.contents: With your parent or guardian, complete the exercises in the booklet, How to Protect Your Children from Child Abuse.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 1a
fields.contents: Play catch with someone 10 steps away. Play until you can throw and catch.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 1b
fields.contents: Walk a line back and forth. Do it sideways too. Then walk the edge of a board six steps each way.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 1c
fields.contents: Do a front roll.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 1d
fields.contents: Do a back roll.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 1e
fields.contents: Do a falling forward roll.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 1f
fields.contents: See how high you can jump.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 1g
fields.contents: Do the elephant walk, frog leap, and crab walk.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 1h
fields.contents: Using a basic swim stroke, swim 25 feet.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 1i
fields.contents: Tread water for 15 seconds or as long as you can. Do your best.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 1j
fields.contents: Using a basketball or playground ball, do a -

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 1k
fields.contents: Do a frog stand.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 1l
fields.contents: Run or jog in place for 5 minutes.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 2a
fields.contents: Give the Pledge of Allegiance to the flag of the United States of America. Tell what it means.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 2b
fields.contents: Lead a flag ceremony in your den.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 2c
fields.contents: Tell how to respect and take care of the U.S. flag. Show three ways to display the flag.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 2d
fields.contents: Learn about the flag of your state or territory and how to display it.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 2e
fields.contents: Learn how to raise a U.S. flag properly for an outdoor ceremony

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 2f
fields.contents: Participate in an outdoor flag ceremony.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 2g
fields.contents: With the help of another person, fold the U.S. flag.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 3a
fields.contents: Make a chart and keep track of your health habits for two weeks.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 3b
fields.contents: Tell four ways to stop the spread of colds.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 3c
fields.contents: Show what to do for a small cut on your finger.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 3a
fields.contents: Make a list of phone numbers you need in case of an emergency. Put a copy of this list by each phone or in a central place in your home. Update it often.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 3b
fields.contents: Tell what to do if someone comes to the door and wants to come in.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 3c
fields.contents: Tell what to do if someone calls on the phone.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 3d
fields.contents: When you and your family leave home,

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 3e
fields.contents: Talk with your family members. Agree on the household jobs you will be responsible for. Make a list of your jobs and mark off when you have finished them. Do this for one month. Citizenship Belt Loop #1

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 3f
fields.contents: Visit an important place in your community, such as a historic or government location. Explain why it is important.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 4a
fields.contents: Make a list of phone numbers you need in case of an emergency. Put a copy of this list by each phone or in a central place in your home. Update it often.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 4b
fields.contents: Tell what to do if someone comes to the door and wants to come in.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 4c
fields.contents: Tell what to do if someone calls on the phone.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 4d
fields.contents: When you and your family leave home,

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 4e
fields.contents: Talk with your family members. Agree on the household jobs you will be responsible for. Make a list of your jobs and mark off when you have finished them. Do this for one month.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 4f
fields.contents: Visit an important place in your community, such as a historic or government location. Explain why it is important.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 5a
fields.contents: Point out and name seven tools. Do this at home, or go to a hardware store with an adult. Tell what each tool does.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 5b
fields.contents: Show how to use pliers.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 5c
fields.contents: Identify a Philips head and a standard screw. Then use the right tool to drive and then remove one from a board.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 5d
fields.contents: Show how to use a hammer.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 5e
fields.contents: Make a birdhouse, a set of bookends, or something else useful.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 6a
fields.contents: Complete the Character Connection for Positive Attitude.
fields.additional_info: Know. Discuss with your family how a cheerful and positive attitude will help you do your best at school and in other areas of your life. Commit. Discuss with your family how gathering items for a collection may be difficult. How does a hopeful and cheerful attitude help you to keep looking for more items. Why is a positive attitude important?Practice. Practice having a positive attitude while doing the requirements for "Start a Collection."

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 6b
fields.contents: Make a collection of anything you like. Start with 10 things. Put them together in a neat way.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 6c
fields.contents: Show and explain your collection to another person.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 7a
fields.contents: Complete the Character Connection for Respect.
fields.additional_info: Know. Discuss these questions with your family: What things have people done to show a lack of respect to our world? Why is it important to respect our environment and ntural resources? How can you show respect for your environment? Commit. Discuss with your family how you feel when you see places in your neighborhood that have lots of litter. Name one thing you can do to help the environment. Practice. Practice being respectful while doing the requirements for "Your Living World."

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 7b
fields.contents: Land, air and water can get dirty. Discuss with your family ways this can happen.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 7c
fields.contents: It takes a lot of energy to make glass, cans, and paper products. You can help save energy by collecting these items for use again. Find out how recycling is done where you live. Find out what items you can recycle.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 7d
fields.contents: With an adult, pick up litter in your neighborhood. Wear gloves to protect your hands against germs and cuts from sharp objects.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 7e
fields.contents: With an adult, find three stories that tell how people are protecting our world. Read and discuss them together.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 7f
fields.contents: Besides recycling, there are other ways to save energy. List three ways you can save energy, and do them.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 8a
fields.contents: Study the Food Guide Pyramid. Name some foods from each of the food groups shown in the pyramid.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 8b
fields.contents: Plan the meals you and your family should have for one day. List things your family should have from the food groups shown in the Food Group Pyramid. At each meal, you should have foods from at least three food groups.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 8c
fields.contents: Help fix at least one meal for your family. Help set the table, cook the food, and wash the dishes.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 8d
fields.contents: Fix your own breakfast. Wash and put away the dishes.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 8e
fields.contents: With an adult, help to plan, prepare, and cook an outdoor meal.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 9a
fields.contents: Complete the Character Connection for Responsibility.
fields.additional_info: Know. Discuss these questions with your family: How does being responsible help us be safe? Within the past week, how did you show responsibility? Commit. Discuss these questions with your family: What happens when people are not responsible? What things can make you forget to be responsible? What things will help you be more responsible? Practice. Practice being responsible while doing the requirements for "Be Safe at Home and on the Street."

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 9b
fields.contents: WITH AN ADULT, check your home for hazards and know how to make your home safe. Citizenship Pin #4

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 9c
fields.contents: WITH AN ADULT, check your home for danger from fire.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 9d
fields.contents: Practice good rules of street and road safety.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 9e
fields.contents: Know the rules of bike safety.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 10a
fields.contents: Complete the Character Connection for Cooperation.
fields.additional_info: Know. Discuss these questions with your family: What is "cooperation"? Why do people need to cooperate when they are doing things together? Name some ways that you can be helpful and cooperate with others. Commit. Discuss with your family what makes it hard to cooperate. How do listening, sharing, and persuading help us cooperate? Practice. Practice being cooperative while doing the requirements for "Family Fun."

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 10b
fields.contents: Make a game like one of these. Play it with your family.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 10c
fields.contents: Plan a walk. Go to a park or a wooded area, or visit a zoo or museum with your family.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 10d
fields.contents: Read a book or Boys' Life magazine with your family. Take turns reading aloud. Communicating Pin #5

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 10e
fields.contents: Decide with Akela. what you will watch on television or listen to on the radio.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 10f
fields.contents: Attend a concert, a play, or other live program with your family.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 10g
fields.contents: Have a family Board Game night at home with members of your family.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 11a
fields.contents: Complete the Character Connection for Faith.
fields.additional_info: Know. What is "faith"? With your family, discuss some people who have shown their faith - who have shown an inner strength based on their trust in a higher power or cause. Discuss the good qualities of these people. Commit. Discuss these questions with your family: What problems did these faithful people overcome to follow or practice their beliefs? What challenges might you face in doing your duty to God? Who can help you with these challenges? Practice. Practice your faith while doing the requirements for "Duty to God."

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 11b
fields.contents: Talk with your family about what they believe is their duty to God.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 11c
fields.contents: Give two ideas on how you can practice or demonstrate your religious beliefs. Choose one and do it.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 11d
fields.contents: Find out how you can help your church, synagogue, mosque, temple, or religious fellowship.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 12a
fields.contents: Complete the Character Connection for Courage.Know. Discuss with your family what "courage" is. Review the requirements and discuss how you might need courage in each one to do what is right. Commit. Give some examples of when it is hard to do the right thing. Discuss with your family times that it might take courage to be honest and kind. Tell about a time in your life when you needed to be brave and courageous to do the right thing. Practice. Practice learning about courage while doing the requirements for "Making Choices." With family members, act out the choices you would make for some of the requirements.

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 12b
fields.contents: There is an older boy who hangs around Jason's school. He tries to give drugs to the children. What would you do if you were Jason?

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 12c
fields.contents: Lee is home alone. The phone rings. When Lee answers, a stranger asks if Lee's mother is home. She is not. Lee is alone. What would you do if you were Lee?

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 12d
fields.contents: Justin is new to your school. He has braces on his legs and walks with a limp. Some of the kids at school tease him. They want you to tease him, too. What would you do?

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 12e
fields.contents: Juan is on a walk with his little sister. A car stops and a man asks them to come over to the car. What would you do if you were Juan?

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 12f
fields.contents: Matthew's grandmother gives him money to buy an ice-cream cone. On the way to the store, a bigger boy asks for money and threatens to hit Matthew if he does not give him some money. If you were Matthew what would you do?

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 12g
fields.contents: Chris and his little brother are home alone in the afternoon. A woman knocks on the door and says she wants to read the meter. She is not wearing a uniform. What would you do if you were Chris?

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 12h
fields.contents: Sam is home alone. He looks out the window and sees a man trying to break into a neighbor's back door. What would you do if you were Sam?

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 12i
fields.contents: Mr. Palmer is blind. He has a guide dog. One day as he is crossing the street, some kids whistle and call to the dog. They want you and your friends to call the dog, too. What would you do?

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 12j
fields.contents: Some kids who go to Bob's school want him to steal candy and gum from a store, which they can share later. Bob knows this is wrong, but he wants to be popular with these kids. What would you do if you were Bob?

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 12k
fields.contents: Paul and his little sister are playing outdoors. A very friendly, elderly woman stops and watches the children for a while. Paul doesn't know the woman. She starts to talk to them and offers to take Paul's little sister on a walk around the block. What would you do?

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 1
fields.contents: Feats of Skill

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 2
fields.contents: Your Flag

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 3
fields.contents: Keep Your Body Healthy

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 4
fields.contents: Know Your Home and Community

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 5
fields.contents: Tools for Fixing and Building

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 6
fields.contents: Start a Collection

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 7
fields.contents: Your Living World

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 8
fields.contents: Cooking and Eating

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 9
fields.contents: Be Safe at Home and on the Street

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 10
fields.contents: Family Fun

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 11
fields.contents: Duty to God

fields.name: Wolf Requirement 12
fields.contents: Making Choices

fields.name: Wolf Elective 1
fields.contents: It's a Secret

fields.name: Wolf Elective 1d
fields.contents: Use 12 American Indian signs to tell a story.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 1b
fields.contents: Write to a friend in invisible "ink".

fields.name: Wolf Elective 1c
fields.contents: "Write" your name using American Sign Language. People who are deaf use this language.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 1a
fields.contents: Use a secret code.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 2
fields.contents: Be an Actor

fields.name: Wolf Elective 2e
fields.contents: Make a paper-sack mask for a skit.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 2c
fields.contents: Make sound effects for a skit.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 2d
fields.contents: Be the announcer for a skit.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 2b
fields.contents: Make some scenery for a skit.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 2a
fields.contents: Help to plan and put on a skit with costumes.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 3
fields.contents: Make It Yourself

fields.name: Wolf Elective 3e
fields.contents: Or make something else.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 3d
fields.contents: Make a door stop.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 3c
fields.contents: Make and use a bench fork.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 3b
fields.contents: Use the ruler on this page to see how far you can stretch your hand.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 3a
fields.contents: Make something useful for your home or school. Start with a recipe card holder.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 4
fields.contents: Play a Game

fields.name: Wolf Elective 4f
fields.contents: Play a wide-area or large group game with your den or pack.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 4e
fields.contents: Play a game of marbles.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 4c
fields.contents: Play Ring Toss.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 4d
fields.contents: Play Beanbag Toss.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 4b
fields.contents: Play Marble Sharpshooter.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 4a
fields.contents: Play Pie-tin Washer Toss.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 5
fields.contents: Spare-Time Fun

fields.name: Wolf Elective 5h
fields.contents: Make or put together some kind of model boat, airplane, train, or car.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 5i
fields.contents: Make or put together some kind of model boat, airplane, train, or car.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 5g
fields.contents: Make or put together some kind of model boat, airplane, train, or car.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 5f
fields.contents: Make a model boat with a rubber-band propeller.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 5e
fields.contents: Make and use a reel for kite string.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 5d
fields.contents: Make and fly a three-stick kite.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 5b
fields.contents: Make and fly a paper bag kite.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 5c
fields.contents: Make and fly a two-stick kite.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 5a
fields.contents: Explain safety rules for kite flying.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 6
fields.contents: Books, Books, Books

fields.name: Wolf Elective 6c
fields.contents: Books are important. Show that you know how to take care of them. Open a new book the right way. Make a paper or plastic cover for it or another book.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 6b
fields.contents: Choose a book on a subject you like and read it. With an adult, discuss what you read and what you think about it.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 6a
fields.contents: Visit a bookstore or go to a public library with an adult. Find out how to get your own library card. Name four kinds of books that interest you (for example, history, science fiction, how-to-books).

fields.name: Wolf Elective 7
fields.contents: Foot Power

fields.name: Wolf Elective 7c
fields.contents: Make a pair of "foot racers" and use them with a friend.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 7b
fields.contents: Make a pair of "puddle jumpers" and walk with them.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 7a
fields.contents: Learn to walk on a pair of stilts.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 8
fields.contents: Machine Power

fields.name: Wolf Elective 8c
fields.contents: Show how to use a pulley.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 8d
fields.contents: Make and use a windlass.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 8b
fields.contents: Help an adult do a job using a wheel and axle.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 8a
fields.contents: Name 10 kinds of trucks, construction machinery, or farm machinery and tell what each is used for.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 9
fields.contents: Let's Have a Party

fields.name: Wolf Elective 9b
fields.contents: c. Make a gift or toy like one of these and give it to someone.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 9a
fields.contents: Help with a home or den party.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 10
fields.contents: American Indian Lore

fields.name: Wolf Elective 10a
fields.contents: Read a book or tell a story about American Indians, past or present.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 10b
fields.contents: Make a musical instrument American Indians used.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 10c
fields.contents: Make traditional American Indian clothing.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 10d
fields.contents: Make a traditional item or instrument that American Indians used to make their lives easier.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 10e
fields.contents: Make a model of a traditional American Indian house.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 10f
fields.contents: Learn 12 American Indian word pictures and write a story with them.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 11
fields.contents: Sing-Along

fields.name: Wolf Elective 11f
fields.contents: Sing a song with your den at a pack meeting.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 11e
fields.contents: Learn and sing a song that would be sung as a grace before meals. Write the words in the space below.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 11d
fields.contents: Learn the words and sing the first verse of three other songs, hymns, or prayers. Write the verse of one of the songs you learned in the space below.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 11c
fields.contents: Learn the words and sing three Cub Scouting songs.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 11a
fields.contents: Learn and sing the first and last verses of "America."

fields.name: Wolf Elective 11b
fields.contents: Learn and sing the first verse of our national anthem.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 12
fields.contents: Be an Artist

fields.name: Wolf Elective 12f
fields.contents: Make a poster for a Cub Scout project or a pack meeting

fields.name: Wolf Elective 12e
fields.contents: Make a stencil pattern.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 12d
fields.contents: Help draw, paint, or color some scenery for a skit, play, or puppet show.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 12c
fields.contents: Mix yellow and blue paints, mix yellow and red, and mix red and blue. Tell what color you get from each mixture.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 12b
fields.contents: Tell a story in three steps by drawing three cartoons.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 12a
fields.contents: Make a freehand sketch of a person, place, or thing.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 13
fields.contents: Birds

fields.name: Wolf Elective 13f
fields.contents: Put out a birdhouse and tell which birds use it.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 13e
fields.contents: Feed wild birds and tell which birds you fed.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 13d
fields.contents: Point out 10 different kinds of birds (five may be from pictures).

fields.name: Wolf Elective 13c
fields.contents: Read a book about birds.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 13b
fields.contents: Put out nesting material (short pieces of yarn and string) for birds and tell which birds might use it.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 13a
fields.contents: Make a list of all the birds you saw in a week and tell where you saw them (field, forest, marsh, yard, or park).

fields.name: Wolf Elective 13T
fields.contents: s elective is also part of the Cub Scout World Conservation Award.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 14
fields.contents: Pets

fields.name: Wolf Elective 14d
fields.contents: Tell what is meant by rabid. Name some animals that can have rabies. Tell what you should do if you see a dog or wild animal that is behaving strangely. Tell what you should do if you find a dead animal.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 14c
fields.contents: Read a book about a pet and tell about it at a den meeting.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 14b
fields.contents: Know what to do when you meet a strange dog.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 14a
fields.contents: Take care of a pet.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 15
fields.contents: Grow Something

fields.name: Wolf Elective 15e
fields.contents: Visit a botanical garden or other agricultural exhibition in your area.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 15c
fields.contents: Grow a plant indoors.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 15d
fields.contents: Plant and raise vegetables.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 15b
fields.contents: Plant and raise a flower bed.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 15a
fields.contents: Plant and raise a box garden.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 16
fields.contents: Family Alert

fields.name: Wolf Elective 16c
fields.contents: Make a list of your first-aid supplies, or make a first-aid kit. Know where the first-aid things are kept.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 16a
fields.contents: Talk with your family about what you will do in an emergency.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 16b
fields.contents: In case of a bad storm or flood, know where you can get safe food and water in your home. Tell how to purify water. Show one way. Know where and how to shut off water, electricity, gas, or oil.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 17
fields.contents: Tie It Right

fields.name: Wolf Elective 17f
fields.contents: Learn to tie a necktie.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 17g
fields.contents: Wrap the end of a rope with tape to keep it from unwinding.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 17e
fields.contents: Tie two cords together with an overhand knot.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 17d
fields.contents: Tie a stack of newspapers the right way.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 17c
fields.contents: Wrap and tie a package so that it is neat and tight.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 17b
fields.contents: Tie your shoelaces with a square bow knot.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 17a
fields.contents: Learn to tie an overhand knot and a square knot.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 18
fields.contents: Outdoor Adventure

fields.name: Wolf Elective 18g
fields.contents: Point out poisonous plants. Tell what to do if you accidentally touch one of them.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 18e
fields.contents: Help plan and lay out an adventure trail.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 18f
fields.contents: Take part in two summertime pack events with your den.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 18d
fields.contents: Help plan and lay out an obstacle race. Use this idea or make up your own.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 18c
fields.contents: Help plan and lay out a treasure hunt something like this.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 18b
fields.contents: With an adult, help plan and run a family or den outing.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 18a
fields.contents: Help plan and hold a picnic with your family or den.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 19
fields.contents: Fishing

fields.name: Wolf Elective 19f
fields.contents: Show how to use a rod and reel.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 19e
fields.contents: Tell about some of the fishing laws where you live.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 19d
fields.contents: Know the rules of safe fishing.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 19c
fields.contents: Fish with members of your family or an adult. Bait your hook and do your best to catch a fish.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 19b
fields.contents: Rig a pole with the right kind of line and hook. Attach a bobber and sinker, if you need them. Then go fishing.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 19a
fields.contents: Identify five different kinds of fish.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 20
fields.contents: Sports

fields.name: Wolf Elective 20d
fields.contents: Understand the safety and courtesy code for skiing. Show walking and the kick turn. Do climbing with a side step or herringbone. Show the snowplow or stem turn, and how to get up from a fall.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 20c
fields.contents: Earn the Cub Scouting shooting sports Archery belt loop.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 20b
fields.contents: Know boating safety rules.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 20a
fields.contents: Play a game of tennis, table tennis, or badminton.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 20e
fields.contents: Know the safety rules for ice skating. Skate, without falling, as far as you can walk in 50 steps. Come to a stop. Turn from forward to backward.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 20f
fields.contents: In roller skating, know the safety rules. From a standing start, skate forward as far as you can walk in 50 steps. Come to a stop within 10 walking steps. Skate around a corner one way without coasting. Then do the same coming back. Turn from forward to backward.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 20g
fields.contents: Go bowling.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 20h
fields.contents: Show how to make a sprint start in track. See how far you can run in 10 seconds.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 20i
fields.contents: Do a standing long jump. Jump as far as you can.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 20j
fields.contents: Play a game of flag football.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 20k
fields.contents: Show how to dribble and kick a soccer ball. Take part in a game.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 20l
fields.contents: Play a game of baseball or softball.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 20m
fields.contents: Show how to shoot, pass, and dribble a basketball. Take part in a game.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 20n
fields.contents: Earn the Cub Scouting shooting sports BB-gun shooting belt loop.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 20o
fields.contents: With your den, participate in four outdoor physical fitness-related activities.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 21
fields.contents: Computers

fields.name: Wolf Elective 21c
fields.contents: Tell what a computer mouse is. Describe how a CD-ROM is used.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 21b
fields.contents: Explain what a computer program does. Use a program to write a report for school, to write a letter, or for something.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 21a
fields.contents: Visit a business where computers are used. Find out what the computers do.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 22
fields.contents: Say It Right

fields.name: Wolf Elective 22e
fields.contents: Invite a boy to join Cub Scouting or help a new Cub Scout through the Bobcat trail.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 22d
fields.contents: Tell how to get to a nearby fire station or police station from your home, your den meeting place, and school. Use directions and street names.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 22c
fields.contents: Tell a short story to your den, your den leader, or an adult.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 22a
fields.contents: Say "hello" in a language other than English.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 22b
fields.contents: Count to 10 in a language other than English.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 23
fields.contents: Let's Go Camping

fields.name: Wolf Elective 23h
fields.contents: With your den or pack or family, participate in a worship service outdoors.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 23g
fields.contents: Participate with your den at a campfire in front of your pack.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 23f
fields.contents: Attend resident camp in your area.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 23e
fields.contents: Attend day camp in your area.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 23d
fields.contents: Explain Buddy System.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 23c
fields.contents: Tell what to do if you get lost.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 23b
fields.contents: Explain the basics of how to take care of yourself in the outdoors.

fields.name: Wolf Elective 23a
fields.contents: Participate with your pack on an overnight campout.

fields.name: Art Belt Loop Requirement 1
fields.contents: Make a list of common materials used to create visual art compositions

fields.name: Art Belt Loop Requirement 2
fields.contents: Demonstrate how six of the following elements of design are used in a drawing: lines, circles, dots, shapes, colors, patterns, textures, space, balance, or perspective.

fields.name: Art Belt Loop Requirement 2
fields.contents: Identify the three primary colors and the three secondary colors that can be made by mixing them. Show how this is done using paints or markers. Use the primary and secondary colors to create a painting.

fields.name: Flag Football Belt Loop Requirement 1
fields.contents: Explain or discuss the simple rules of flag football with your den.

fields.name: Flag Football Belt Loop Requirement 2
fields.contents: Practice running, passing, and catching skills for at least 30 minutes.

fields.name: Flag Football Belt Loop Requirement 3
fields.contents: Play a game of flag football.
